item.title: Monica add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "I know, but I do not approve. And I am not resigned." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Monica add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
Monica add a quote by Utah Phillips
item.description: "The state can't give you freedom, and the state can't take it away. You're born with it, like your eyes, like your ears. Freedom is something you assume, then you wait for someone to try to take it away. The degree to which you resist is the degree to which you are free..." -- Utah Phillips

item.title: Monica add a quote by Utah Phillips
item.description: "Sing your song Dance your dance Tell your story I will Listen and remember" -- Utah Phillips

item.title: Monica add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Monica add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "People have only as much liberty as they have the intelligence to want and the courage to take." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The political arena leaves one no alternative, one must either be a dunce or a rogue. " -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "There is no flag large enough to cover the shame of killing innocent people." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Monica add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "I wonder how the foreign policies of the United States would look if we wiped out the national boundaries of the world, at least in our minds, and thought of all children everywhere as our own." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Monica add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "History is important. If you don't know history it is as if you were born yesterday. And if you were born yesterday, anybody up there in a position of power can tell you anything, and you have no way of checking up on it." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Monica add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "We don't have to engage in grand, heroic actions to participate in the process of change. Small acts, when multiplied by millions of people, can transform the world." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Monica add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Monica add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Colorless green ideas sleep furiously." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Monica add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "The smart way to keep people passive and obedient is to strictly limit the spectrum of acceptable opinion, but allow very lively debate within that spectrum...." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Monica add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Monica add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Most problems of teaching are not problems of growth but helping cultivate growth. As far as I know, and this is only from personal experience in teaching, I think about ninety percent of the problem in teaching, or maybe ninety-eight percent, is just to help the students get interested. Or what it usually amounts to is to not prevent them from being interested. Typically they come in interested, and the process of education is a way of driving that defect out of their minds. But if children['s] ... normal interest is maintained or even aroused, they can do all kinds of things in ways we don't understand." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Monica add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Someone has said that it requires less mental effort to condemn than to think." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most people don't realize how important librarians are. I ran across a book recently which suggested that the peace and prosperity of a culture was solely related to how many librarians it contained. Possibly a slight overstatement. But a culture that doesn't value its librarians doesn't value ideas and without ideas, well, where are we?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Monica add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Monica add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Monica add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Monica add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The three rules of the Librarians of Time and Space are: 1) Silence; 2) Books must be returned no later than the last date shown; and 3) Do not interfere with the nature of causality." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Monica add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Good books, like good friends, are few and chosen; the more select, the more enjoyable." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Monica add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I've got the key to my castle in the air, but whether I can unlock the door remains to be seen." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Monica add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Wild roses are fairest, and nature a better gardener than art." -- Louisa May Alcott
